author: Devdiscourse News Desk
title: Vice President Predicts Unstoppable Rise for India | Education
text: Vice President Predicts Unstoppable Rise for India Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar highlighted India‚Äôs unstoppable rise and its recognition by global institutions during a lecture at NMIMS University. He emphasized the role of education in achieving equality and noted the nation's transformation over the past decade that has garnered international attention. [Devdiscourse News Desk](/devdiscourse-stories)| Mumbai | Updated: 12-07-2024 13:47 IST | Created: 12-07-2024 13:47 IST - Country: - India Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar highlighted India's unstoppable rise and its recognition by global institutions during a lecture at NMIMS University. He emphasized that the nation's progress over the next five years would be like a rocket defying gravitational force. Dhankhar stressed that education plays a crucial role in achieving equality and is the most impactful transformational mechanism. He noted that while India was once considered a 'sleeping giant,' it is now a nation on the move, receiving accolades from international bodies. The Vice President underscored the country's rapid transformation in the past decade, which has led to global institutions seeking advice from India. (Disclaimer: With inputs from agencies.) author: @TIMESNOW
title: iQOO Neo7 5G: Unbeatable Value After Price Drop | A Deep Dive into Specs, Upgrades, and Competition | Technology & Science News, Times Now
text: iQOO Neo7 5G Gets Price Cut in India: Still a Strong Contender in Sub-30k Segment? With a significant price cut, the iQOO Neo7 5G emerges as a compelling option in the sub-30,000 segment. Boasting a 6.78-inch AMOLED display, Dimensity 8200 processor, 256GB storage, and 120W fast charging, the smartphone competes against rivals like OnePlus Nord 3 5G and Nothing Phone (1). iQOO has officially slashed the price of the Neo7 5G ahead of the iQOO Neo9 Pro launch in India. iQOO is preparing for the launch of its next flagship, the iQOO Neo9 Pro, in February. But before that, the brand has slashed the price of the existing iQOO Neo7 5G, particularly the 12GB RAM + 256GB storage variant. With this price drop, the Neo7 becomes an even more tempting proposition in the sub-30,000 price range. But is it still the best choice? Let's dive in. Discounted Delight: Impressive Specs at a Lower Price The price cut brings the Neo7 5G down to ‚Çπ27,999, a significant drop from its original ‚Çπ31,999. For this price, you get a feature-packed phone with a stunning 6.78-inch AMOLED display, a powerful Dimensity 8200 processor, 256GB onboard storage, and a long-lasting 5,000mAh battery with 120W fast charging. The camera setup, including a 64MP primary sensor with OIS, caters to most photography needs. Future-Proof Potential with Android 14 on the Horizon The Neo7 currently runs Android 13-based Funtouch OS 13, but an upgrade to Android 14 is expected soon. iQOO has also promised two major Android updates and three years of security updates, meaning the Neo7 could potentially receive Android 15 as well. Tough Competition in the Sub-30k Battlefield The iQOO Neo7 faces stiff competition in this price segment. The OnePlus Nord 3 5G offers similar performance at a slightly lower price, while the Nothing Phone 1 boasts a unique design and impressive camera capabilities. Ultimately, the choice depends on your individual priorities. the Neo7 5G is still a strong contender in the sub-30,000 segment, especially with its attractive new price tag. However, it's crucial to weigh its strengths against the competition before making a purchase decision. author: UK & international sports
title: Kansas City Chiefs advance past the Miami Dolphins in freezing conditions | Express & Star
text: Kansas City Chiefs advance past the Miami Dolphins in freezing conditions A matchup between the Bills and Pittsburgh Steelers in Buffalo was rescheduled to Monday due to a potentially dangerous snowstorm. The Kansas City Chiefs outlasted the Miami Dolphins in freezing conditions to take a step towards a fourth Super Bowl appearance in five years. With the temperature at a near-NFL-record low of minus 20C, Chiefs quarterback Patrick Mahomes was instrumental in leading his side to a dominant 26-7 victory. Mahomes threw for 262 yards and a touchdown without turning the ball over on a night where rushing was the focal point of Kansas City‚Äôs offence. The strategy paid off as the Chiefs opened the scoring in the first few minutes and stayed in front from there. An injury-depleted Miami was far from their high-scoring best, finishing with just 264 total yards as the Dolphins remain without a play off victory since 2000. The cold weather wreaked havoc across the first day of the super wild card round, with the matchup between the Bills and Pittsburgh Steelers in Buffalo being rescheduled to Monday due to a potentially dangerous snowstorm. Elsewhere, CJ Stroud threw for three touchdowns as the Houston Texans demolished the Cleveland Browns 45-14. Stroud racked up 274 yards in the air without a turnover, while Browns quarterback Joe Flacco was picked off twice in the heavy loss.

author: Josh Sanchez
title: Von Miller Breaks Silence On Domestic Violence Arrest; Allegations ‚Äò100% False‚Äô
text:
Von Miller is finally breaking his silence on last month‚Äôs domestic violence arrest.
The
Buffalo Bills star pass rusher was available to the media on Thursday when he commented on the incident that led to his arrest. Miller was accused of choking his pregnant ex-girlfriend in Dallas during the team‚Äôs bye week.
Miller adamantly denied the allegations, saying that they are ‚Äú100 percent false.‚Äù
‚ÄúWhenever you see that stuff pop up in articles and stuff ‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs shocking of course, especially when my name is attached to it,‚Äù Miller said, via
Syracuse.com. ‚Äúbut it is 100% false. It‚Äôs overblown. I‚Äôve got the right people on the job.‚Äù
Von Miller speaking to the media today for the first time since the alleged incident on November 30th
[#BillsMafia]| [#GoBills]| [#BuiltinBuffalo]
[pic.twitter.com/ICUrr57mwL]
‚Äî Built in Buffalo (@BuiltInBuffalo_)
[December 28, 2023]
He added, ‚ÄúMe and my girlfriend, we have problems just like any other couple does. But there has never been any of those things that was alleged against me. ‚Ä¶ The people who know me and the people who have been around me know my character, they know who I am.
‚ÄúAll I can say is it is just a matter of time before everything gets set straight. For me, that‚Äôs all I really have to say is it didn‚Äôt happen and it‚Äôs just a matter of time before everything is set straight.‚Äù
Miller has continued to suit up for the Bills and has not been criminally charged as the investigation continues.

author: @kfvsnews
title: 4-year-old and infant in Colorado found safe after endangered missing alert
text: 4-year-old and infant in Colorado found safe after endangered missing alert STERLING, Colo. ( [KKTV](https://www.kktv.com/2023/12/28/statewide-alert-issued-colorado-missing-4-year-old-infant/)/Gray News) - A statewide alert issued in Colorado on Thursday for two young children has been canceled, [KKTV reports.](https://www.kktv.com/2023/12/28/statewide-alert-issued-colorado-missing-4-year-old-infant/) The Colorado Bureau of Investigation issued an alert for 4-year-old Zuryah Thalacker and 23-month-old Ansom Thalacker. Officials say the two children were located and were safe as of 3 p.m. on Thursday. Officials say the children have been missing since Wednesday at 1:30 p.m. when they were last seen in the Sterling area. The alert stated that the children may have been with 28-year-old Justina Lambert. The CBI did not disclose the relationship between the three in the alert. The alert said the children were believed to be traveling in a 2007 White Nissan Murano with CA license plate 9ERA912, with the rear bumper missing. Copyright 2023 KKTV via Gray Media Group, Inc. All rights reserved.

author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Boston Celtics News: Mazzulla Talks Future, Tatum and Brown‚Äôs Growth
text:
Boston Celtics News: Mazzulla Talks Future, Tatum and Brown‚Äôs Growth
The
Boston Celtics are gearing up for the upcoming NBA season as reigning champions, setting ambitious expectations for their key players, especially Jayson Tatum and Jaylen Brown. Coach Joe Mazzulla emphasizes maintaining championship intensity and embracing the challenges of being a target for other teams. Former players and current NBA insiders share insights and predictions about the Celtics' future, including possible roster changes and the team's performance expectations. Former Celtics guard Evan Fournier signed with Greek team Olympiacos, while Rajon Rondo faces legal issues after pleading guilty to a gun charge. Amid trade rumors and player developments, the Celtics' commitment to repeating as champions remains a central theme.
- Celtics coach Joe Mazzulla has stated he wants his team to embrace having a target on their backs after winning the 2024 NBA title.
- Jayson Tatum's performance is anticipated to be the best yet as he enters the new season alongside Jaylen Brown.
Critics argue that the pressures of defending a title can affect team dynamics and player performance. Some observers believe that success depends not only on talent but also on how well the team handles the expectations associated with their championship status.State of Play
- The Celtics are preparing for training camp with a mix of excitement and pressure as defending champions.
- Rumors suggest potential roster changes, including discussions on waiving certain players post-training camp.
Looking ahead, the Celtics will focus on integrating their new and existing players to strengthen team chemistry. The upcoming preseason is crucial for setting the tone as they vie for consecutive championships while evaluating their roster for possible adjustments.Bottom Line
The Boston Celtics are at a critical juncture as they prepare to defend their title, emphasizing teamwork and resilience while recognizing the challenges of maintaining success. Their ability to embrace the pressure and leverage their talent will be key to navigating the 2024-25 NBA season.

author: laregione.ch
title: Rien ne va plus per Alinghi a Barcellona | laRegione.ch
text:
Altri sport Rien ne va plus per Alinghi a Barcellona Lo scafo elvetico battuto anche nella seconda regata (contro American Magic) della Louis Vuitton Cup Lo scafo elvetico ‚Äòatterra‚Äô e quello americano prende il largo 30 agosto 2024 | di Red.Sport Non accenna a chiudersi la serie nera di Alinghi, uscito sconfitto anche nella sua seconda regata della Louis Vuitton Cup. Stavolta, al largo di Barcellona, lo scafo battente bandiera elvetica si √® dovuto inchinare al Challenger statunitense di American Magic. In una giornata caratterizzata da un vento capriccioso, Arnaud Psarofaghis e compagni di avventura hanno iniziato subito male la sfida e non sono pi√π riusciti a raddrizzarla. Tanto che alla terza boa il distacco nei confronti dell'imbarcazione statunitense era ormai incolmabile. Come era successo il giorno prima nella sfida con i francesi di Orient Express, l'equipaggio elvetico ha dunque dovuto vestire i panni dell'inseguitore, ruolo che non √® praticamente mai riuscito a interpretare, prova ne √® che il distacco √® rapidamente lievitato, fino a toccare il minuto.
La situazione √® letteralmente crollata quando, al termine del secondo segmento di gara, Alinghi √® stato costretto a ‚Äòridecollare‚Äô, perdendo altro prezioso tempo in attesa che il vento rendesse nuovamente utilizzabili le vele. Da notare che proprio le particolari condizioni del vento hanno costretto gli organizzatori ad accorciare la gara a quattro sole boe, delle sei originariamente previste.
Il secondo kappa√≤ in altrettante sfide nell'ambito della Louis Vuitton Cup relega gli elvetici al quinto e ultimo rango della classifica da cui, al termine del doppio Round Robin, usciranno i nomi dei quattro challenger promossi alle semifinali. Per rilanciare le chance di rientrare nel quartetto buono occorrer√† dunque invertire al pi√π presto la tendenza. Nella terza giornata di gare, gli elvetici saranno impegnati in una doppia regata: dapprima contro Ineos Britannia e poi con il Defender Team New Zealand (ininfluente per√≤ ai fini della classifica).
